qas.question: What do great powers usually have?

answers.text: military and economic strength, as well as diplomatic and soft power influence

qas.question: What are the permanent members of UN Security Council?

answers.text: China, France, Russia, the United Kingdom and the United States

qas.question: What are the countries in the G7?

answers.text: Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom and the United States of America

qas.question: What 3 factors have international relations theorists considered factors for great power status?

answers.text: power capabilities, spatial aspects, and status dimensions

qas.question: What great power has five permanent members?
What international structure exerts its influence on a global scale?

plausible_answers.text: great power status can be characterized into power capabilities, spatial aspects, and status dimensions.

qas.question: What has the United Nations Security Council characterized as comprising great power status?
What spatial aspects are Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom and the United States a part of?
In what conference are great powers opinions formally considered?

context: <b5_0>A great power<b5_0/> is a sovereign state that is recognized as having the ability and expertise to exert its influence on a global scale. Great powers characteristically possess <a0_0>military and economic strength, as well as diplomatic and soft power influence<a0_0/>, which may cause middle or small powers to consider the great powers' opinions before taking actions of their own. International relations theorists have posited that <b6_0>great power status can be characterized into <a3_0>power capabilities, spatial aspects, and status dimensions<a3_0/>.<b6_0/> Sometimes the status of great powers is formally recognized in conferences such as the <b8_0>Congress of Vienna<b8_0/> or an international structure such as the <b4_0>United Nations Security Council<b4_0/> (<a1_0>China, France, Russia, the United Kingdom and the United States<a1_0/> serve as the body's five permanent members). At the same time the status of great powers can be informally recognized in a forum such as <b7_0>the G7<b7_0/> which consists of <a2_0>Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom and the United States of America<a2_0/>.
